summary: The concept of "planning of space," which redirects to the preferred term "area management," pertains to the strategic organization and regulation of land use within the EU's environmental policy framework. Area management encompasses the systematic approach to spatial planning, ensuring sustainable development while balancing ecological integrity and socio-economic needs. This regulatory concept is vital for implementing EU directives aimed at protecting biodiversity, managing natural resources, and mitigating climate change impacts. Effective area management facilitates compliance with EU environmental legislation, promoting cohesive governance across member states and fostering collaborative efforts in regional development initiatives.
